subdisciplines.name: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI)
subdisciplines.description: A neuroimaging technique that uses magnetic resonance imaging to measure brain activity by detecting changes associated with blood flow.

subdisciplines.name: Positron Emission Tomography (PET)
subdisciplines.description: A neuroimaging technique that uses radioactive tracers to measure brain activity by detecting changes in blood flow, metabolism, and neurotransmitter activity.

subdisciplines.name: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (MRS)
subdisciplines.description: A neuroimaging technique that uses magnetic resonance imaging to measure chemical concentrations in the brain.
